result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessica Marie Lohman in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Jessica Marie Lohman.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Uzowulu just appointed. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Jessica Marie Lohman in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Total bond set to cover all cases with added condition. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

TOTAL BOND TO COVER ALL CASES 22CM535, 22CM536, 22CM517 & 22GF1014. 

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.J.S. dob 9-14-1990 OR C.A.S. dob 1-25-1996. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
